description: I thought this looked exactly like what I needed. After installing, it didn't appear in my software list, but I finally figured out how to start the app using a terminal command. I played around with it for only a few minutes - long enough to discover that it is not very intuitive. At this point, it will be easier to continue doing my charts in a text editor. This one needs some work.

Hi Dean, Thank you for your feedback. The app now has an icon and can be found and launched from the graphical user interface.  If you have any further suggestion to make the app more intuitive please let me know.

I wanted to open some Chordpro files with it - didn'T find a way to do it. It just shows me some songs I do not care for.
Useless, sorry

One user reported having trouble using Chordpro files. On Linux, put all of your ChordPro files into a folder named "SessionCharts" in your home folder/directory. All common ChordPro file suffixes are supported. I use ".cho".  To take full advantage of SessionCharts features, use the SessionCharts native plain text format. These files have a ".sc" suffix. See the manual to learn how to use this format. Put them in the same SessionCharts folder along with your ChordPro files. These files will be loaded when you start SessionCharts. Or, if SessionCharts is already running, use the "refresh" command in the hamburger menu to update the index after making any changes to the SessionCharts folder.
